intro: Lepanthes hoeijeri, commonly known as the Orchid of the Andes, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments within cloud forests. The plant features delicate, greenish-white flowers with intricate patterns and a short, erect stem. Its roots are adapted to absorb moisture from the forest floor, and it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Lepanthes hoeijeri is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts.
